description: A traditional technique used in desert regions to harvest rainwater, allowing moisture to seep into the soil and recharge groundwater, supporting crop cultivation in dry climates.
steps: Identify suitable land slopes for water collection.
Construct barriers to direct rainwater flow.
Create small ponds or trenches to hold water.
Allow water to spread across agricultural land.
risks: Erosion of soil if not properly managed
Potential for water stagnation leading to pests
